intro: Chelyocarpus ulei, commonly known as the mangrove apple, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Arecaceae and is characterized by its ability to thrive in brackish water environments. The plant has a distinctive appearance with thick, waxy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a fibrous, spiny structure that contains a single seed. This species plays an important role in coastal ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
